intro: Oxydectes glabella, commonly known as the smooth oxydectes, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a shrub with woody stems and small, narrow leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, arranged in clusters, and it produces small, dry fruits called cypselae. Oxydectes glabella is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
